intro: Capanemia paranaensis, commonly known as the Paranaensis Capanemia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in riverine forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
